description: From Middle English bedclothys, plural of Middle English bedcloth, bedclothe, bedde clothe (“bed-cloth, bedding”), from Old English bedclāþ, beddclāþ (“coverlet, blanket, bedding, bedclothes”), equivalent to bed +‎ clothes.

entries.meaning: Sheets, blankets, quilts or other coverings used on a bed.
examples: She pulled the bedclothes over her neck to stay warm.
Tom put his bedclothes on and went to sleep.
